en: The Bell Building was built in 1942 at a cost of $293, 285.82 and razed 2014. An office building, it was only the second building on campus after Austin Hall to be oriented with the compass, facing almost due west. Originally built to house the state offices of the Agricultural Adjustment Administration, it later housed various agencies of the U. S. Department of Agriculture.
